author: PINGHAI
content: We're working on decorations for the Lunar New Year!

comments.content: You're splitting the workload, I presume? You need a lot of decorations for LNY.

replies.content: Yep! Ning draws them and I hang them up!

comments.content: not particularly exciting for a juustagram post... anyway, I assure you, we're hard at work.

replies.content: Do you need help? I see your hand slipped on that bottom right stroke...
oops, yeah... it was just a cramp. we'll manage!

comments.content: I still think it looks really good.

replies.content: really? you can thank Ying Swei for that. she taught me how to do it.
You showed talent for it, after all. Commander, would you like a lesson in calligraphy too?

author: CaitSith
content: It's time to start the cat ear revolution (*ΦωΦ*)

comments.content: Ooh! Ooh! Do Belfast first!

replies.content: Don't you want a cute pair of your own too? :3
Umm... I'll decide after I see how they look on Belfast! ^_^;
Aww! But they'd look great on mew~!

comments.content: Well, if they're free of charge, I suppose they might come in handy some day.

replies.content: They're not just free, they're mandatory~ >:3
Haha! I'll take a pair if you don't mind.
All yours, Neptune~! Heck, take several and give them to your friends~

comments.content: As long as it's achieved by peaceful means!

replies.content: Of course~ Now don't you wanna try on a pair, Owner? :3

comments.content: Am I at risk for being... revolutionized?
If you're asking if I have a set of ears reserved for you, the answer is... YES :3

author: Chapaev
content: Look! Aren't my new friends adorable?

comments.content: With an army of these, you could conquer the great frozen tundra.

replies.content: An army of cute little snowmen, you say? I'm on it!

comments.content: What're those red things they've got on their blobby little necks?

replies.content: Just a little something to keep them balanced (and loyal)! Cute, right?

comments.content: Nice. I made a snow кролик.

replies.content: Wh-what does milk "do" to you? I just have a bottle or two after a bath...

comments.content: A collar is, let's say, a "novel" item to put on a snowman...

replies.content: I've got normal-sized ones too! Interested in trying one out, Commander?

author: Bremerton
content: Just chilling and waiting for the gang to show up~

comments.content: You hanging out with Astoria today?

replies.content: Plus a few others! By the way you checked out the latest edition of fashion d'azur yet?
Fashion d'Azur? Can't say I have. Usually I just consult you when I need fashion advice.

comments.content: Didn't expect to spend the whole afternoon chatting about fashion. Let's do it again next time you're free!

replies.content: Ayy, time flies. I'm free whenever so just hit me up when you are
Astoria's into fashion too huh. Almost starting to feel like the odd one out here.
You're missin out bigtime Balti. Why not join us for the next meetup? It'll be fun!
Hm... I'll think about it.

comments.content: They still sell that tea? Thought the hype around it died down.

replies.content: Kinda, but the drink survived! Some places are putting out new flavors too so they're making a small comeback

comments.content: Where is this place in the photo? Looks comfy.

replies.content: It's rated 4.7 stars for a reason! I'll DM you the address later so you can check it out

author: Pola
content: A refined lady fusses over the details, including, but not limited to, her nails.

comments.content: Interesting... So that's what I need in order to blossom! I see, I see!

replies.content: There are many ways to ladydom, GB. This is just one. Would you like to know more?
In fact, yes, I would! Please be my guiding lady, Pola!

comments.content: Pola's always been really good at painting nails, both her own and mine. Thanks for the nail art, by the way.

replies.content: You're welcome, sis. It's always a pleasure to work with your hands.

comments.content: You could open a nail salon with your level of skill!

replies.content: Oh please, I'm only an enthusiast. And besides, my other skills have more relevancy at the moment~

comments.content: Nail art? Sounds like more than a single-color coating.

replies.content: It is. Nail art can get quite intricate and colorful. Would you like to give it a try, Commander~?

comments.content: I was NOT expecting Above Average Joe to vanquish Thanatos with a punch to the face! Like, just a regular right hook!

replies.content: That's why his character is so good! He doesn't need OP powers, he wins using only his wits and unpredictability!
Yeah! And how he had to pick up his father's mantle, figuratively and literally, that really spoke to me.

comments.content: Did they really have to keep the camera moving like, constantly? My head was spinning by the end of the film...

replies.content: Sorry, I'd forgotten the director is kind of infamous for that. I'll find a film with gentler camerawork for next time!
Could we vote on what film to watch instead? I know of a fascinating Saratoga documentary that Gridley made.
Isn't that a little niche? I say we find a film we can all enjoy!

comments.content: I kinda spaced out near the film's start middle and end but the potato chips were good!

replies.content: That's fine too. Feel free to stop by again next time!

comments.content: New life goal: vanquish a Siren by punching it.

replies.content: Hahaha! Maybe someday, Commander. Anyone can be a hero with the right mindset!

comments.content: Best movie I've seen in ages!

replies.content: Right?! The scene where he comes back from the brink of death is pure kino!

author: Richelieu
content: After hearing so much about this signature Dragon Empery dish, today, I finally tried hot pot.

comments.content: It was an honor to get to prepare it for you, Miss Richelieu. How did you like it?

replies.content: It was excellent. Enlightening, even. It gave me a look into a whole other world of cuisine.

comments.content: Though certainly appetizing, isn't mutton prepared in this manner highly unorthodox?

replies.content: What is unorthodox varies by culture. More than this I cannot say... other than that it is very spicy.
We'll have a great get-together soon, with lots of hot pot on the menu. You're free to join us and try it for yourself, Jeanne d'Arc!

comments.content: You can tell it's spicy just from the pic alone!

replies.content: It truly is. You feel the heat not just on your tongue, but through your whole body! It is an intense experience.

comments.content: Hot pot sounds like a good remedy to winter chills.

replies.content: It is quite warming, but take care not to overeat it. Your stomach will thank you later.

comments.content: Nothing soothes the soul quite like cuddling cute kitties does.

replies.content: my soul would've been more soothed if you hadn't forced me to come along. just saying.
You say that, but you sure seemed to be enjoying yourself, snuggling with those cats.
i didn't snuggle anything, they lied down next to me, that's all.

comments.content: That cafe is heaven on earth! I wanna see that black kitty again!

replies.content: Let's visit it again then. How about next week?

comments.content: Makes me wish I had a cat.

replies.content: Why not get one then? There's space in your office, isn't there? Hehehe~

comments.content: They might be even cuddlier than Meowfficers are.

replies.content: I can vouch for the fact that they are. But don't take my word for it, why not go and see for yourself?

author: YIXIAN
content: Dumplings are an essential part of the #SpringFestival

comments.content: We helped make them! And taste-tested a few too!

replies.content: I told you a million times, Ping... you're not supposed to eat raw, unstuffed dumplings.
But my stomach was growling like a Nian beast! Plus, they were yummy as-is!

comments.content: I admire how you can mold dumplings into all kinds of different shapes, Yat Sen. All I can make are regular, boring ones...

replies.content: Don't beat yourself up over it. At least you do better than Chao Ho.
Hey, rude! I can do it if I just concentrate, okay?

comments.content: Hehe, I wonder who'll be the lucky taster of my spicy surprisy ghost pepper dumplings!

replies.content: Your WHAT?! Chang Chun, get over here RIGHT NOW!

comments.content: They're tricky to fold just the right way. Takes skill.

replies.content: Indeed they are, but you're quite good at it, Commander!

comments.content: Dinner can't come fast enough! Need dumplings!

replies.content: You said it! I'm so hungry I could eat a dumpling horse!

author: Champagne
content: Sweet are these nuggets, gelatinous their skin. Their chewy casings cover the delectable contents within.

comments.content: Aren't those tangyuan? That dessert they eat during holidays in the Dragon Empery?

replies.content: They seem almost... magical! I must have one!
I know but one truth–the sublime flavor of these forbidden fruits.

comments.content: Isn't that tangyuan... glowing? And quite a lot, at that?

replies.content: I don't think food in general is supposed to glow!
Food serves one purpose: to satiate hunger. The light is my respect for the meal, manifested.

comments.content: So, is this your glowing recommendation for tangyuan?

replies.content: Its savor must be experienced, not described. A taste shall enlighten you.

author: ChangChun
content: Did someone say FIRECRACKERS?! Watch out, port city, it's gonna be a loud night!

comments.content: Once you crackle and pop, you can't stop!

replies.content: Aw yeah! And that barrel-size firecracker you set off at the end was amazing!
It was really pretty. But also tremendously loud... like thunder struck right next to us.
Hey, you can't make a firecracker omelet without almost cracking a few ear drums!

comments.content: It's only a matter of time before you get hurt if you keep making these colossal firecrackers...

replies.content: I'm not dumb! I know how to dive for cover! And don't pretend like you don't enjoy watching it go off!
Look, it's called supervision! If I don't keep an eye on you, then who will?

comments.content: Just good, clean, explosive fun!

replies.content: Yeah! Besides, we're trained in the use of naval cannons, so what harm can a few firecrackers do?

comments.content: What's a festival without firecrackers, right?

replies.content: This! It's like popcorn without salt! You need a bit of (read: a lot of) bang-bang!

comments.content: Wow! Looks dangerous, but fun!

replies.content: Depends on the slope and your experience but yeah! Give it a go, Kent!

comments.content: that's me on the left there. never found any new pets among the snow, but skiing was wunsy-funsy

replies.content: You were looking for pets on a snowy mountain? Are you even allowed to have pets? I have so many questions...

comments.content: Aw yeah, that mountain's good for skiing. And snowmobiling! Shoulda seen me yesterday!

replies.content: First skateboarding, now snowmobiling? What sports AREN'T you good at, Minny?

comments.content: Skiing is good and all, just be careful!

replies.content: It's perfectly safe, don't worry. This was just a beginner's course!

comments.content: Putting that winter gear to good use, I see.

replies.content: Always have! Not every day I get to use it on land though!

author: Dido_Doll
content: I'm knitting a sweater for Master, made with love...

comments.content: Whereas I'm incapable of knitting even a scarf! Truly, I am a pitiable maid deserving of punishment!

replies.content: It's no big deal. I can't knit, heck, most people here can't.
I'm confident that the commander will recognise the effort that went into your craft, no matter what you make.

comments.content: You have quite the knack for knitting, don't you, Dido?

replies.content: My ability still pales in comparison to yours...

comments.content: Hah, Sirius looks like a wee cat playing with a baw of yarn.

replies.content: What a naughty kitty...

comments.content: I feel warmer just looking at this picture.

replies.content: A direct reply from Master!! You're too kind to me! Thank you, thank you, thank you so much, Master!!!
Honourable Master! Now you've seen how woefully incompetent I am! Please, punish me however you see fit!

author: Drake
content: This is a public service announcement! Eat fruit! The fresher, the better!

comments.content: I'm with you on that one. Fruit is good for your health and protects you from malnourishment and disease.

replies.content: Like scurvy! You don't wanna know what it does to you, just eat fruit rich in vitamin C!

comments.content: What about fruit juice? Doesn't that work just as well? :3

replies.content: I suppose? It isn't precisely the same thing, but it's fine as long as it's freshly squeezed.

comments.content: Pardon, but did you take these fruits from the kitchen, by any chance? It is to be served later tonight.

replies.content: I'm making a point here! Don't stress the details.

comments.content: You could make a juicy fruit salad out of these.

replies.content: Sure. Whatever gets the fruit down your gullet at the end of the day.

comments.content: An apple a day keeps the doctor away, as they say.

replies.content: It's true! Combine that with a balanced diet and you're set.

author: Kashino
content: Whew! A bottle of cold milk after a hot bath always hits the spot~

comments.content: Milk, huh. Milk... I guess you really are what you eat -_-

replies.content: I'm... milk? I don't see what you mean...

comments.content: Is THIS what milk does to you?! This is simply ridiculous! How long have you been drinking it for?!

replies.content: Wh-what does milk "do" to you? I just have a bottle or two after a bath...

comments.content: I smell money to be made, nya! @Shiranui Place an order for 50 crates of milk, nya!

replies.content: Perhaps we should invest in dairy farm stocks as well... This could be a big market, green cat.

comments.content: Milk is nice, and so is its source... Hummina hummina...

replies.content: Pardon? Huh... Would you like me to bring you some milk, Commander? It's good for your bones!

author: Kuma✩
content: Aw yeah, this came out lookin nice!

comments.content: Now that it's actually up on Juustagram it feels just like, kind of weird... a little childish idk.

replies.content: Don't say that. You look cute together.
Thanks! Wanna make it a group photo and pose with us, Mogami?
Thanks, but I'll pass. I'll ask Mikuma if she wants to go instead though.

comments.content: Childish?? Yoooo what are you talking about you both look sooo cute! @Baltimore let's take a photo like this rn!

replies.content: What? Now?! I'd need time to prepare!

comments.content: This pic has a certain ying-yang quality to it.

replies.content: Hey yeah I see what you mean! Almost makin me feel like a palette swap here lol

comments.content: I never knew Suzuya liked lollipops.

replies.content: It's mainly just for the photo, although I do like having one every now and then.

author: VV_Littorio
content: Lovely signorinas and exquisite food. My two biggest vices. They combo quite well, too!

comments.content: The dinner party was splendid, Miss Littorio. Thank you so much for inviting us.

replies.content: No, signorina, thank YOU for coming. I always cherish our time together.

comments.content: Sardegnian food never disappoints! And neither did our gracious host!

replies.content: I would've loved to indulge myself in all the delicacies on offer, but a lady must watch her calorie intake...
I'm glad to hear it. Your gratitude makes all my efforts worth it.

comments.content: Wining and dining is a tried and tested strategy!

replies.content: Indeed, and I consider myself an expert at it. Wouldn't you agree, Commander?
